meanings.definition: Engaged in a noisy, rough, or violent fight or quarrel.
meanings.sent1: The brawled cats made a lot of noise in the alley.
meanings.sent2: The brawled argument between the siblings could be heard from the next room.
meanings.sent3: The brawled party guests were having too much fun with their loud games.
meanings.sent4: The brawled storm outside matched the chaos in the house.
meanings.sent5: The brawled scene in the movie was so intense, it felt real.

meanings.definition: Participated in a physical altercation or scuffle.
meanings.sent1: The kids brawled over the last piece of cake at the party.
meanings.sent2: The two wrestlers brawled fiercely in the ring for the championship.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully brawled over who got to sit in the front seat of the car.
meanings.sent4: The rival gangs brawled in the street, causing chaos in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The monkeys brawled over the banana, each trying to grab it first.
